heisig_chinese_memo: For sleeping the underling is treated like a normal person and given a nice bed because they want him to have the energy to work hard. &nbsp
Ru_trainchinese:
wò: (глаг) (о людях) лежать, ложиться; (о животных) сидеть, припадать к земле; спать; (диал.) варить (яйца) без скорлупы
wò: (графема) спальное место, спальная полка
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the man (人) and the subject (臣) lie down
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The underling is lucky to have a magician for a master - for sleeping the magician just zaps the underling to sleep with his magic wand.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " person ", from " chen ", the original meaning is lying down and resting. "Shuowen": "Xiu Ye. From the person, the minister, take the one. All the people who lie down are from the bed." In the word " chen " is the pictogram of " head ", which has nothing to do with the " chen " of the person and minister. In ancient times, " sleeping " and " lying " were two different ways of sleeping. "Mencius·Gongsun Chouxia": "Sit, you shouldn't, but you lie down." Jiao Xunzheng: "Lying and sleeping are different, sleeping on the bed, "The Analects of Confucius" "Sleep without corpse" is also; , "Mencius" "Hidden Ji and Lying" is also. Lying on Ji, so it is called "V"."

" Lying " is also extended to sleep. "Xunzi·Jiebi": "When the heart lies, dreams." "Historical Records: The Biographies of Grandson Wu Qi": "Lying without seats, walking without riding." Hou Shu Mao Xizhen's Seventh "Huanxi Sha": "Half Drunk and Concentrated Love Lying on Embroidery, my sleep capacity is unable to unload the skirt."

" Lying " can mean lying down. Wei Xu's "Moxu" quotes the Southern Dynasties Emperor Liang Wu's "Book Review": "The book of Wang Xi is like a dragon leaping over the gate of heaven, and a tiger lying on the phoenix." Song Linbu's poem "Mao'er": "You must be small when you are hooked. The stream fishes are full of flowers in the shade."

" Lying " can also mean lodging, "Sui Shu-Etiquette III": "The commander first priests, so that the commander sees the flag to point to the trail, and the meaning of launching, the flag will kneel."

" Lying " in ancient books can also refer to dormitory and seclusion. The former is like "The Book of Han·Han Xin Zhuan": "(The King of Han) claimed to be a Han envoy and galloped into the wall. Zhang Er and Han Xin did not rise, they would lie down and seize their seals." The latter is like "The Book of Jin-Xie An Zhuan": "Zhong Cheng Gao Song's play said: "Qing is tired against the decree of the court, lying high on the mountain, and every person will say anything, but if the stone refuses to come out, it will be like the common people!
humanum_short_description_en: From " person ", from " chen ", the original meaning is lying down and resting.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，從「臣」，本義為伏著休息。《說文》：「休也。从人、臣，取其伏也。凡臥之屬皆从臥。」字中「臣」為「目」之象形，與人臣之「臣」無關。在古代，「寢」與「臥」是兩種不同的睡法。《孟子‧公孫丑下》：「坐而言，不應，隱几而臥。」焦循正義：「臥與寢異，寢於床，《論語》『寢不尸』是也；臥於几，《孟子》『隱几而臥』是也。臥於几，故曰伏。」

　　「臥」亦引申為睡覺。《荀子‧解蔽》：「心臥則夢。」《史記‧孫子吳起列傳》：「臥不設席，行不騎乘。」後蜀毛熙震〈浣溪紗〉之七：「半醉凝情臥繡茵，睡容無力卸羅裙。」

　　「臥」可表示趴伏，韋續《墨藪》引南朝梁武帝《書評》：「王羲之書，如龍躍天門，虎臥鳳闕。」宋林逋詩〈貓兒〉：「纖鉤時得小溪魚，飽臥花蔭興有餘。」

　　「臥」還可表示倒伏，《隋書‧禮儀志三》：「將帥先教士目，使習見旌旗指麾之蹤，發起之意，旗臥則跪。」

　　「臥」在古書中還可指寢室，也指隱居。前者如《漢書‧韓信傳》：「﹝漢王﹞自稱漢使，馳入壁。張耳、韓信未起，即其臥，奪其印符。」後者如《晉書‧謝安傳》：「中丞高崧戲之曰：『卿累違朝旨，高臥東山，諸人每相與言，安石不肯出，將如蒼生何！』」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，從「臣」，本義為伏著休息。

Chinese Definition:
Ideographic: A person 人 laying on a bed 臣
Freq: 6463
Kanshudo mnemonic:the man (人) and the subject (臣) lie down
Chinese: For sleeping the underling is treated like a normal person and given a nice bed because they want him to have the energy to work hard.  
Meaning: for sleeping
Hanzi: 卧
Story: The underling is lucky to have a magician for a master - for sleeping the magician just zaps the underling to sleep with his magic wand.
Kind: traditional

從「 人 」，從「 臣 」，本義為伏著休息。《說文》：「休也。从人、臣，取其伏也。凡臥之屬皆从臥。」字中「 臣 」為「 目 」之象形，與人臣之「 臣 」無關。在古代，「 寢 」與「 臥 」是兩種不同的睡法。《孟子‧公孫丑下》：「坐而言，不應，隱几而臥。」焦循正義：「臥與寢異，寢於床，《論語》『寢不尸』是也；臥於几，《孟子》『隱几而臥』是也。臥於几，故曰伏。」 「 臥 」亦引申為睡覺。《荀子‧解蔽》：「心臥則夢。」《史記‧孫子吳起列傳》：「臥不設席，行不騎乘。」後蜀毛熙震〈浣溪紗〉之七：「半醉凝情臥繡茵，睡容無力卸羅裙。」 「 臥 」可表示趴伏，韋續《墨藪》引南朝梁武帝《書評》：「王羲之書，如龍躍天門，虎臥鳳闕。」宋林逋詩〈貓兒〉：「纖鉤時得小溪魚，飽臥花蔭興有餘。」 「 臥 」還可表示倒伏，《隋書‧禮儀志三》：「將帥先教士目，使習見旌旗指麾之蹤，發起之意，旗臥則跪。」 「 臥 」在古書中還可指寢室，也指隱居。前者如《漢書‧韓信傳》：「﹝漢王﹞自稱漢使，馳入壁。張耳、韓信未起，即其臥，奪其印符。」後者如《晉書‧謝安傳》：「中丞高崧戲之曰：『卿累違朝旨，高臥東山，諸人每相與言，安石不肯出，將如蒼生何！』」

臥字的基本解释

臥
wò
同“卧”。

臥字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wò］
［《廣韻》吾貨切，去過，疑。］
亦作“臥1”。
(1)伏着休息。
(2)睡；躺。
(3)趴伏。
(4)倒伏；使倒伏。
(5)平放着，横陈。
(6)寝室。
(7)特指床。
(8)指隐居。
(9)犹止息。
(10)保温。
(11)今方言指把去壳的鸡蛋放到开水里煮。

臥字的康熙字典解释

【未集下】【臣字部】　臥； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页999第17
【唐韻】吾賀切【集韻】【韻會】吾貨切【正韻】五箇切，?音餓。【說文】休也。从人臣，取其伏也，人臣事君俯僂也。【長箋】因休義借寐也。【廣韻】寢也。【釋名】化也，精氣變化，不與覺時同也。【禮·樂記】魏文侯問於子夏曰：吾端冕而聽古樂，則唯恐臥。　又【韻會】寢室曰臥。【後漢·宦者傳論】乃以張卿爲大謁者，出入臥內。　又息也。【管子·白心篇】臥名利者寫生危。【註】息其名利之心，則無危生之累也。

臥字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
臥字的起名意思

暂无。

Lying
Basic explanation of words
Lying
wò
Same as "Lying".
Lying
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wò］
["Guangyun" I have cut my goods, have been there, suspicious. ]
Also known as "Sleep 1".
(1) Lie down and rest.
(2) To sleep; to lie down.
(3) Lie down.
(4) Lodging; causing lodging.
(5) Lay flat, horizontally.
(6) The bedroom.
(7) Especially refers to the bed.
(8) Refers to seclusion.
(9) Still stopped.
(10) Keep warm.
(11) In this dialect, the shelled eggs are boiled in boiling water.
Lying
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Not set next] [Chen Zi Department] 　wo; Kangxi strokes: 8; page number: page 999 page 17
[Tang Yun] I He Cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] My Goods Cut [Zheng Yun] Five Qi cuts, the sound is hungry. [Said the text] Hugh also. From the person to the minister, whichever is to be taken, the person and the minister are the king. [Long note] Because of Xiuyi, I also borrowed the sleep sound. [Guang Yun] Sleeping too. 【Release name】Hua Ye, the change of essence, not the same as Jue Shi. [Rite and Music] Wei Wenhou asked Yu Zixia: I am afraid to lie down while listening to ancient music.　[Yunhui] The dormitory is called sleeping. [Post-Han·Eunuch Biography] It is Zhang Qing who is a great admirer, going in and out of the bed.　Retire again. [Guan Zi·White Heart] Those who lie in fame and wealth sketch life in danger. [Note] If the heart of fame and fortune is relieved, there is no danger of life.
